availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William S. Atwood (Ottawa, Michigan, lawyer and soldier)

body.p: Ottawa, Michigan, lawyer and soldier. Ohio native. Married to Ella A. Atwood. Attorney in Ottawa County, Michigan, in 1860. Served in the 1st Michigan Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A) as a major from August 1861 to January 1863. Captured at Bull Run, Virginia. Prisoner of war from August 30, 1862, to October 17, 1862. Attorney in Washtentaw County, Michigan, in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Michigan, Ottawa County, Ottawa, p. 421.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Washtenaw County, MI, June 1863, p. 10.
“Colonel Brodhead’s Regiment,”Detroit Free Press(Detroit, Michigan), September 15, 1861.
"William S. Atwood (1834-1867)," Find A Grave, Memorial #75309966, accessed September 19, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/75309966.
